sources.title: Christmas Holiday (1944) Directed By Robert Siodmak, Starring Gene Kelly, Deanna Durbin
sources.description: Christmas Holiday is a 1944 FILM NOlR crime film directed by Robert Siodmak starring Deanna Durbin and Gene Kelly. Based on the 1939 novel of the same name by W. Somerset Maugham, the film received an Academy Award nomination for Best Musical Score for Hans J. Salter.   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia and read an article from F ILM NOlR of the Week . There is also a good review of the movie here from the movie blog Where Danger Lives .

metadata.Plot: Due to inclement weather, Lt. Charles Mason is forced to spend Christmas in New Orleans. Recently dumped by his girlfriend, the depressed Lieutenant falls in with Jackie Lamont, a singer who works at a nightclub and brothel. After attending midnight mass together, she tells her story to Charles. Her real name is Abigail and she fell in love with Robert Manette. After six months of happy married life, Robert is arrested for murder, but Abigail can't help loving her no-good husband.
metadata.Writer: W. Somerset Maugham, Herman J. Mankiewicz
metadata.Actors: Deanna Durbin, Gene Kelly, Richard Whorf
